fields.value: Characterisation of dwellers and their activity in Cameroon

authorAffiliation.value: Center for International Forestry Research / Institut de recherche pour le developpement
Center for International Forestry Research / Centre de cooperation internationale en recherche agronomique pour le developpement
Center for International Forestry Research / Universite de Dschang

datasetContactAffiliation.value: Center for International Forestry Research / Institut de recherche pour le developpement

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This dataset contains tables of household census,  quaterly surveys of agricultural, gathering, hunting and artisanal logging activities,  with names of main crop, NTFP, Bushmeat and timber species used by local communities for their livelihood and cash revenues. It also has columns with the quantity collected, the percentage sold, the revenue obtained, the type of ecosystem where product are extracted, statut of the collector and the type of buyer. in addition to this, we have a table (suivi activ dépenses) that gives household expenses and agregate quarterly survey revenues of all activities.
The informations were obtained using socio-economic surveys : social transect, focus groups, census, individual interviews of key informants and quarterly survey of households in 12 villages located in and around two logging concessions of the South and East Regions of Cameroon.  25 % of household were surveyed in each village with a minimum of 5 household.

publicationCitation.value:
Levang, P.; Lescuyer, G.; Noumbissi, D.; Déhu, C.; Broussolle, L. (2015)
Does gathering really pay? Case studies from forest areas of the East and South regions of Cameroon, Forests, Trees and Livelihoods 24(2) p. 128-143 ISSN: 1472-8028

Lescuyer, G.; Mvongo-Nkene, M.N.; Monville, G.; Elanga-Voundi,M.B.; Kakundika. T. (2015) Promoting multiple-use forest management: which trade-offs in the timber concessions of Central Africa?. Forest Ecology and Management 39 p. 20–28
